title: Lee Radziwill chic: the story behind the Christie's auction which means we can all now get the look
text:
Lee Radziwill was renowned not just for being Jacquline Kennedy Onassis’s sister, but also for her exquisite, and expensive, taste. “It is fantastic how much she costs to dress,” her second husband Prince Stanislaw Radziwill once said. Radziwill died in February aged 85, 20 years after her younger sister’s death. On Thursday, her family is auctioning a collection of her possessions at Christie’s in New York.

Across 168 lots, there are glimpses from every chapter of Radziwill’s extraordinary life. “We really have the whole gamut of her life,” says Jonathan Rendell, Christie’s Deputy Chairman. “We have her silver mug from 1933, her high school ring from Miss Porter's. We have the china she used...
description: Lee Radziwill was renowned not just for being Jacquline Kennedy Onassis’s sister, but also for her exquisite, and expensive, taste.
